6f263a52-4f8f-5ca5-8650-116b298c0880.title: Reference Documents: Drawings and drawing registers

349f50c3-fda3-5660-bb1a-30cc6342bded.title: Acceptance Criteria: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:

da4561b3-93b8-55a1-b566-9186a992c1c7.title: Frequency: Prior to commencing any activity

eb6888db-d91f-5d2b-bd7b-689885c1e64b.title: using the correct and complete set of drawings all drawings are the latest revision

3c87d162-5151-5563-ba11-c08a09ea7234.title: Reference Documents: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP

1219bcfc-3dac-53fa-b5f8-02da64c9bd56.title: Frequency: Prior to commencing any activity

05e21734-8bdb-5cb6-a87e-8a9b9ae8e9b4.title: Acceptance Criteria: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP

meta.name: 1.2 Implementation of all measures and controls

ea772bf3-373a-5a09-9b55-b5c5c222041c.title: Acceptance Criteria: The Contractor shall submit the concrete mix design details for review by the Superintendent not less than 4 weeks prior to the placement of concrete. Concrete shall not be placed until the mix design has been reviewed by the Superintendent, and allocated a registration number on the Register of VicRoads approved concrete mixes.

89e48fa3-7441-5a87-936a-64d5358f9308.title: Frequency: Prior to commencing any activity

3b8864b4-bca1-5dff-b118-bf4907c0018d.title: Frequency: Prior to commencing any activity

01c45d1f-b823-5ac9-9478-fe0a3816d0e4.title: Reference Documents: VR Spec 611 VR Spec 613 VR Spec 614 Cl 614.07

7adb7342-f4de-50c8-a6f9-41c8b9288e10.title: Acceptance Criteria: Falsework shall comply with the requirements of Section 613 and AS 3610 Formwork shall comply with the requirements of Section 614 and AS 3610 Void formers shall comply with the requirements of Cl 614.07 Reinforcement shall comply with the requirements of Section 611, contract drawings and standard drawings

dda2ff5d-e740-552b-8986-38731044008c.title: Record of Conformity: This ITP Signed Off

7ebc6b64-cd8a-5c95-bcd4-41a626b07617.title: Acceptance Criteria: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing including removal of unsuitable material. Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task. Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation

23abb43f-af67-5ca5-93b8-50a7801246a2.title: Acceptance Criteria: Excavations shall be to the depths shown on the drawings and that necessary to provide satisfactory foundation

0b0dcd9c-4b80-50ec-abb5-d5df7009c56f.title: Acceptance Criteria: Formwork shall be used in such a manner that it can be removed without damage to the concrete. Formwork shall be placed in locations where steel reinforcement and other fixtures can be inspected, and sufficiently tight at joints to to confine freshly placed concrete and maintain position and shape during construction.

40d20c1a-aa13-5836-8113-7169f5906748.title: Acceptance Criteria: A pre-pour survey carried out by a surveyor. Surveyor report obtained prior to concrete pour. Erected formwork within the tolerance (as per Table 610.461 and Table 610.462). Any errors in the level or positioning of formwork is to be corrected prior to placing concrete

ac3b3615-82e3-5d3b-89d8-77b894e97c3e.title: Acceptance Criteria: All steel reinforcement to be securely held during placing and compacting of concrete Supports shall be of a material durable to impose loads without movement of the reinforcement The placement method shall not allow the reinforcement to become contaminated by contact with other steel

4e05c56d-eaf5-5d55-a615-4d5bae707eb3.title: Acceptance Criteria: The specified minimum cover must be maintained at all tire wire positions. A tolerance of 0 to +5mm is allowed.

e35db7e0-8bc7-59f6-a329-ab68eaf43dae.title: Acceptance Criteria: Pre-pour Checklist (CLA) completed and signed.

a2bb86fe-12ab-57fa-8b58-e6c6e390fe59.title: Acceptance Criteria: Superintendent confirms that the inspected formwork, reinforcement and embedments comply with the project drawings and specifications. Hold Point released by the Superintendent.

29a05ac5-2a19-5b67-a0f6-e60536fa7e90.title: Acceptance Criteria: Concrete shall not be place when temperature is <5°C or > 35°C. All steel components that are in contact with the concrete shall be cooled to below 32°C before concrete is placed

82723d60-b2f7-5a37-bf29-9ed9e3f36cec.title: Acceptance Criteria: Compressive and slump sampled to be completed in accordance 610.16 No. of Samples: 0 to 10m3 - 1 No. 10 to 25m3 - 2 No 25m3 + refer to specification

2c43e179-d882-5ccb-b49d-f83010d7bbea.title: Frequency: Each concrete pour as per 6.1

dd6a9293-74f8-59d7-80d9-c35d45610b4c.title: Record of Conformity: Concrete test records

7c6530d6-ae1f-59e8-a096-4f4bf8d1ffc3.title: Acceptance Criteria: Slump testing to be within the tolerances specified in Table 610.162. <60mm = + or - 10mm 60mm to 80mm = + or - 15mm 81mm to 110mm = + or - 20mm 111mm to 150mm = + or - 30mm 151mm+ = + or - 40mm

cbe7d77f-b193-5f8d-8f0b-5518148b981a.title: Record of Conformity: Concrete test records

6a6387ef-3d4b-5a8f-9eaf-4f9d5750ace6.title: Acceptance Criteria: A minimum of one cylinder shall be tested at 7 days and a minimum of 2 cylinders at 28 days. The average compressive strength at 28 days shall not be lower than the specified minimum compressive strength. Additionally, the compressive strength of each individual cylinder shall be no less than 90% of that at 28 days.

8c3f1ebb-569e-556d-86ee-9d452963d45e.title: Frequency: Each concrete pour as per 6.1

2fa06318-71ac-5b6d-841d-a123f2651be2.title: Acceptance Criteria: Concrete shall not be placed until all foreign material has been completely removed from the forms

edfe2ba8-1093-561d-ad77-456f55778689.title: Acceptance Criteria: Discharge time (concrete placed and compacted) < 60 minutes from batch time unless approved otherwise.

7a3d57e5-df0d-5255-85ed-3746867c8550.title: Acceptance Criteria: Concrete shall be transported, handled and placed in a manner that will prevent segregation or loss of materials. Concrete shall not be freely dropped from height >2m. Concrete shall not be moved horizontally by vibrators

02efb41c-3d3f-57a4-a980-cd52d0259d0c.title: Acceptance Criteria: During continuous pours their shall be no more than 25 minutes lag time between truck loads (From Finish to Start)

09b3a4e5-bcd1-523d-97db-e707eac3be39.title: Acceptance Criteria: Vibration shall be applied to the full depth of each layer and extended into the top 100 mm of the underlying layer. Vibration shall continue at each point until air bubbles cease to emerge from the concrete, then withdrawn slowly. Concrete shall not be vibrated to the point where segregation of the ingredients occurs.

fce8acad-9484-5256-978e-67bd67f29c93.title: Acceptance Criteria: The location and details of construction joints shall be as shown on the drawings. The placing of concrete shall proceed continuously from joint to joint. Any point at which the placing of concrete has stopped and the concrete has taken its initial set shall be treated as a construction joint. Before placing new concrete against concrete which has set, the forms shall be re tightened.

a79e1472-1c9a-5938-8ae4-402d290e5664.title: Frequency: Each pour involving construction joint

6e2746d7-e06c-5bdf-9a06-4adeca3c6b34.title: Acceptance Criteria: Formwork not removed/disturbed for the duration of the minimum removal time specified in the Table 610.251. Walls <2m = 2 Days Side of slabs and piles = 1 Day

1ff1690d-4d75-5249-94c1-4fe885091ed0.title: Acceptance Criteria: CL 001F – Post-pour Checklist completed and signed.

e3d095d5-c315-582a-8e85-f90beb2cf941.title: The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Fulton Hogan's Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.

28946c8c-b329-5c82-aa23-f0ab6fb99f86.title: Is the relevant NCR attached to the Lot?

e0284b07-a805-54ed-9792-fef6fd5510d3.title: Are any relevant Mails/ Transmittals attached to the Lot?

77c9912d-ae8d-5cf4-a117-dbcbf4b08c22.title: Is the relevant RFI attached to the Lot?
